meanings.definition: Of or relating to the tragus of the ear.
meanings.sent1: The tragal part of the ear helps with hearing.
meanings.sent2: She gently touched the tragal area of her ear.
meanings.sent3: The tiny tragal section of the ear seemed to have its own personality.
meanings.sent4: His focus on the tragal aspect of the ear was like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the importance of the tragal region for hearing clearly.

meanings.sent1: He felt a tickle in his tragal when he scratched his ear.
meanings.sent2: The tragal can help direct sound into the ear canal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf whispered secrets into her tragal.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, bouncing off her tragal.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered softly against his tragal as he walked in the park.
